thread.title: EU migrants fuel near record levels of migration, official figures expected to show
thread.title_full: EU migrants fuel near record levels of migration, official figures expected to show

author: Steven Swinford
title: EU migrants fuel near record levels of migration, official figures expected to show
text:
EU migrants fuel near record levels of migration, official figures expected to show Britain has seen near record levels of EU migration Steven Swinford , Deputy Political Editor 23 February 2017 â€¢ 7:58am 
M ore than 300,000 migrants came to Britain since the EU referendum vote last year fueled by a surge in EU nationals, official figures are expected to show today. 
The Office for National Statistics will this morning publish figures showing the level of migration for the period July to September, the first full quarter before Britain voted to leave the European Union. 
The previous figures for the year to June showed that net migration remained at near record levels with 335,000 people coming to the UK, while record numbers of people from the EU came to the UK. Watch | UK immigration by numbers 01:06 
S eparate figures are expected to show EU nationals living in Britain rushing to secure their right to remain with record numbers applying for residency certificates. 
The figures are likely to show that immigration remains significantly below Theresa May's target of reducing levels to tens of thousands. At a glance | Reasons for UK immigration 
P revious figures showed that one in ten migrants have come from Romania, reflecting a huge rise since migration controls were lifted in 2014. 
EU net migration, which excludes UK citizens who went to other EU states, was at 189,000. The figures revealed that work is the most common reason for long-term immigration. Watch | May: Points-based migration system won't give us control 01:16
